result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Chappell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice mailed to 321 N Lincoln Avenue #4, Beaver Dam WI 53916 returned "return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward"
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file

Defendant Anthony D. Chappell not in Court.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 5 days jail, consecutive to any previously-imposed sentences.  Huber granted under jail rules. $443 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Court granted 2 days jail credit. DNA sample be submitted.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Dodge Correctional Institution on 1-21-16 at 2:45 pm.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Dodge County Jail on 1/21/16 at 2:45 P.M.
with no contact with Pohlk's Pup, no contact B.P.

Defendant, Anthony D. Chappell, appeared with Atty. Tristan Eagon for the public defender's office. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,500 recog. bond with no contact with Pohlk's Pup, no contact B.P.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
